pullRequest.body:
A continuous map whose codomain is a Hausdorff and compactly generated space is proper if and only if the preimages of compact sets are compact.
A Hausdorff and weakly locally compact space is compactly generated.
A Hausdorff and sequential space is compactly generated.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [fce25e9007](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13635/commits/fce25e90072167631ecd0da5f118bcaea9ebbd98)

<details><summary>

| --- | --- | --- | --- |

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Topology.Maps.Proper.Basic` `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.ProperConstSMul` `Mathlib.Topology.Maps.Proper.UniversallyClosed`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ SequentialSpace.isProperMap_iff_isCompact_preimage`
`+ SequentialSpace.isProperMap_iff_tendsto_cocompact`
`+ WeaklyLocallyCompactSpace.isProperMap_iff_isCompact_preimage`
`+ WeaklyLocallyCompactSpace.isProperMap_iff_tendsto_cocompact`
`+ compactlyGenerated_of_sequentialSpace`
`+ compactlyGenerated_of_weaklyLocallyCompactSpace`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I'll have a look at this later today, but I don't want to be the one to merge this I think because we talked about it a lot during LFTCM (but I think all code here is Ã‰tienne's). This is partially the reason I didn't review this (or the proper actions PR) earlier (I was also super busy), I thought it was better if someone else did the review, but now I feel bad that it had to wait for so long...
I'll let you a week to review and then I'll review myself

> I'll let you a week to review and then I'll review myself

This was a month ago, so I'm going to review it now.

@ADedecker Is there any progress with reviewing different definitions? I think that we should fix one of them, add as a typeclass, and use it here. We may need to add all three in the future. If Definition 1 is enough for our immediate needs (i.e., implies all the properties we're going to prove about these spaces in the near future), then I suggest to go with it, because this will make our theorems that assume `[CompactlyGeneratedTopology X]` stronger.
Do you need help with the git?

Yes I am completely lost. I wanted to solve the merge conflict but I messed up the solving because I added something which in fact had been moved to another file. Anyway I've been trying to revert to commit bd60edd but I can't find a way to do it.

Is there anything of value in that branch after `bd60edd`? If not you can do `git reset HEAD~N` where `N` is the number of commits you want to revert, then do `git push --force`. WARNING: You will lose the content of the commits you've reset (well, not quite lost but much more hardly accessible).
Thank you very much, that's exactly what I needed! I had tried `reset` but then I could not push, I didn't know about the `force` option.
With great power comes great responsibility. You should use `--force` sparingly as it can overwrite other people's work if you collaborate on the same branch.
Yes I looked it up and saw this could happen. Thank you for your help!
UPD: it looks like we're going to use Definition 2 in another series of PRs. Not sure if we need more than one definition right now.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

:v: EtienneC30 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10037955515/job/27738863434)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10037955515/job/27738863785)

Looks okay to me. Any topologist to sign off?

maintainer merge

Thanks!

bors d+

Looks okay to me. Any topologist to sign off?

maintainer merge

Thanks!

bors d+
I don't think the imports need changing at all?
This import is needed for the results mentioning `SequentialSpace`. This won't be necessary when `compactlyGeneratedSpace` typeclass is implemented.
Any particular reason you are deleting this alias? In general, please don't remove aliases in a PR called `feat: Something` unless the alias causes you troubles for some reason
This was not intended, I copied the file that I had in the other PR and did not see that this line had disappeared.
Sounds like you should define the typeclass `Topology.IsCompactlyGenerated`

The idea of generalizing `isProperMap_iff_isCompact_preimage` to compactly generated spaces comes from @ADedecker, but he told me that they were hesitating on the definition to choose (they are many different possible, which are not equivalent). I picked one but I feel like I shouldn't be the one to choose the Mathlib definition.
I'll let Anatole decide here

Yes the point was that we have to choose the best definition among the three defined on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compactly_generated_space). I think #13452 would allow to formulate definition 1 and 3, but probably not option 2. I meant to take the time to study the question a bit more, but I didn't get to do it. I suggested this ad-hoc approach to Ã‰tienne because it contains all the mathematics so switching to a more typical setup would be straightforward.
I think that the docstring should discuss this.

`Iff` is a structure so you can do
```suggestion
    IsProperMap f â†” Continuous f âˆ§ âˆ€ â¦ƒKâ¦„, IsCompact K â†’ IsCompact (f â»Â¹' K) where
  mp hf := âŸ¨hf.continuous, fun _ â†¦ hf.isCompact_preimageâŸ©
  mpr := fun âŸ¨hf, hâŸ© â†¦ isProperMap_iff_isClosedMap_and_compact_fibers.2
    âŸ¨hf, fun _ hs â†¦ (compactlyGenerated _).2
    fun _ hK â†¦ image_inter_preimage .. â–¸ (((h hK).inter_left hs).image hf).isClosed,
    fun _ â†¦ h isCompact_singletonâŸ©
```
which I think is nicer
That's nicer indeed, I didn't know about it. Thanks!

```suggestion
the notion of compactly generated space is not yet in Mathlib (TODO)
so it is used as an intermediate result to prove
```

```suggestion
is not yet in Mathlib (TODO) so we use it as an intermediate result to prove
```

```suggestion
are not yet in Mathlib (TODO), therefore we also add this theorem. -/
```

```suggestion
by typeclass inference, however compactly generated spaces are not yet in Mathlib (TODO),
therefore we also add this theorem. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Characterization of proper maps for Hausdorff and compactly generated spaces
